title: Burglar writes message on dog during home break-in: Cleveland Heights police blotter
text:
Breaking and entering, Cedar Road: At 5:30 p.m. Sept. 28, a man reported that someone broke into his house and damaged some of his property. Someone also drew explicit images and words on his Chihuahua in permanent marker. Several items in the house, including a couch and a coin jar, had been moved, but nothing was missing.
Theft from vehicle, Superior Road: At 11:03 a.m. Sept. 28, a woman told police someone ransacked her car and stole her sunglasses.
Stalking, Yellowstone Road: At 3:44 p.m. Sept. 28, police arrested a man who is accused of stalking his ex-girlfriend and trying to break into her home.
Theft from vehicle, East Derbyshire Road: At 7:56 p.m. Sept. 28, a man reported that someone went into his unlocked vehicle and stole about $10 and a rosary necklace.
Police pursuit, Greyton Road: At 11:48 p.m. Sept. 28, an officer was called to a report of a car parked in a driveway playing loud music. While he was writing down the car's license plate, the driver began to pull out of the driveway. He ignored the officer's commands to stop and drove away. Another officer chased him until he stopped on Selwyn Road. There, the driver got out and ran until he was caught by police. The man was found to be intoxicated. He is charged with OVI, obstructing official business, failure to comply with a police officer's order and multiple traffic violations.
Attempted burglary, Altamont Road: At 5:41 p.m. Sept. 26, a woman told police someone tried to break into her home by kicking in a screen door panel.
Theft from vehicle, Noble Road: At 11:03 p.m. Sept. 26, a man reported that someone broke into his car and stole cologne, a phone charger and sunglasses. Police obtained surveillance video that showed two teenage boys entering the car.
Theft from vehicle, Clarendon Road: At 12:38 p.m. Sept. 26, two people reported that their unlocked vehicles had been broken into. About $4 in change and multiple CDs were missing from the vehicles.
Theft , Silsby Road: At 8 a.m. Sept. 26, a man told police someone stole sunglasses, headphones, $25 in cash and a wallet containing credit cards from his unlocked car.
Burglary, Yellowstone Road: At 11:39 p.m. Sept. 25, a woman reported that someone broke into her home and stole a TV. Investigators think the burglar got inside through an unlocked second-floor window.
Burglary, Hampshire Road: At 10:54 a.m. Sept. 25, a woman reported that someone broke into her apartment, ransacked it and stole various items, including a PlayStation and gaming controllers. Police think the burglar entered the home through a window.
Stolen vehicle found, Noble Road: At 1 p.m. Sept. 25, a woman called police after finding a suspicious vehicle, which was found to have been stolen. A window was shattered and the rear view mirror was knocked loose. The vehicle was returned to its owner.
Bike theft, Superior Road: At 10:20 a.m. Sept. 25, a man reported that someone stole his bike that was chained to a railing behind his apartment complex.
Bike theft, Noble Road: At 7:47 p.m. Sept. 25, a man a told police someone took his bike that he left in his open apartment garage.
OVI, Montford Road: At 2:35 p.m. Sept. 25, police arrested a man accused of drunken driving after pulling him over for erratic driving. The man failed sobriety tests and had a blood-alcohol level of 0.121 percent.
